content.tab: About Garden Savings Federal Credit Union
content: Garden Savings, a non-profit financial cooperative, has been a pioneering leader in the credit union business since its inception in 1968. The credit union now has locations in Parsippany, Newark, Dover, and South Orange. On January 1, 1968, the Garden Savings Federal Credit Union was established. Headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey. It is the seventh biggest credit union in New Jersey, with assets of $429.63 million and more than 27,000 members. Garden Savings Credit Union has 28,188 members and 5 locations in 5 cities. It is also the nation's 764th largest credit union. It has expanded to 68 personnel spread over four sites.The NCUA insures them nationally, while ESI insures them privately. They also take pleasure in being an Equal Housing Lender.

You are eligible to join Garden Savings Federal Credit Union if you are an employee of one of their Select Employer Groups, a relative of an employee, or a member of one of their organizations within the field of membership.
Individuals who have retired as pensioners or annuitants of the organizations, as well as volunteers for the organizations, are also eligible.

You can also join if you live, work, worship, go to school, volunteer, or do business in Newark, Elizabeth, or Jersey City regularly. Your family members are also eligible. (This includes businesses and other legal organizations.)
Joining the American Consumer Council automatically qualifies you to join Garden Savings.

content.header: To start a Garden Savings Federal Credit Union, the following documents are normally required.
content: One current, valid form of identification is permitted, such as a passport or driver's license, a National ID Card is required.
One proof-of-address document, such as a utility bill or a bank statement dated within the last three months.
You may also be requested a PPS number.

link.label: Refer to the link for more details

content: This account requires a minimum deposit of $5 from your basic share savings account; there is no monthly cost for the Base Share Savings account.
Garden Savings Federal Credit Union provides checking accounts, savings accounts, share certificates, Special Share Account, retirement accounts, and, specialty accounts

Garden Savings Federal Credit Union can support credit cards, mortgage loans, personal loans, new and used vehicle loans, business services, internet banking, mobile banking, and other financial services.
Since they're a non-profit organization, their revenues are returned to members in the form of lower lending rates, more interest paid on deposits, and fewer fees.
When you join up, you become a part-owner with an equal vote to elect members of their governing Board of Directors.

You will be able to take advantage of advantages such as cheaper loan rates, higher deposit rates, a variety of value-added educational, financial, and coverage product offers, and easy access to your money.
